Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
public class Player extends Object
The Player class represents a player in the card game. Each player has a name, age, and a hand of cards. A player can draw cards from a deck, discard cards to a discard pile, return cards to a deck, and view their current hand.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Player(String name, int age)
    Constructs a Player with an empty hand.
    Player(String name, int age, Card[] startingHand)
    Constructs a Player with a name, age, and an initial starting hand.

    size()
    Returns the number of cards in the player's hand.
    String
    toString()
    Produces a formatted string containing the player's name, age, and a complete ordered listing of all cards in the player's hand, starting from the top of the hand to the bottom, ending in a period.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name, int age, Card[] startingHand)
      Constructs a Player with a name, age, and an initial starting hand. Null cards in the starting hand are ignored.
      Parameters:
      name - - the player's name
      age - - the player's age
      startingHand - - the initial cards given to the player
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if name is null, empty, age is negative, or startingHand is null

    • Player

      public Player(String name, int age)
      Constructs a Player with an empty hand.
      Parameters:
      name - - the player's name
      age - - the player's age
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if name is null, empty or age is negative

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the player's name.
      Returns:
      the name

    • getAge

      public int getAge()
      Returns the player's age.
      Returns:
      the age

    • getHand

      public Card[] getHand()
      Returns the player's hand as an array of cards. The returned array goes from top of the hand to bottom.
      Returns:
      the player's hand as an array

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of cards in the player's hand.
      Returns:
      the hand size

    • draw

      public void draw(Deck deck)
      Draws a card from the given deck and adds it to the player's hand. If the deck has no cards left, nothing is added.
      Parameters:
      deck - - the deck to draw from
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if deck is null

    • discardCard

      public boolean discardCard(Card card, DiscardPile pile)
      Discards a card from the player's hand into the specified discard pile. Returns true if the card was found and removed, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      card - - the card to discard
      pile - - the discard pile to place the card into
      Returns:
      true if the card was discarded, false if not found
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if card or pile is null

    • returnCard

      public boolean returnCard(Card card, Deck deck)
      Returns a card from the player's hand back into the given deck. Returns true if the card was found in the hand, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      card - - the card to return
      deck - - the deck to return the card to
      Returns:
      true if the card existed and was returned, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if card or deck is null

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Produces a formatted string containing the player's name, age, and a complete ordered listing of all cards in the player's hand, starting from the top of the hand to the bottom, ending in a period.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string showing the player's information and hand ending in period
